result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheila R Pittman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month, starting 04-01-2016 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate: 5 days in the Waukesha County Jail.

Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Sheila R Pittman in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  
Jury Trial Cancelled.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.

Court orders the following:
Fine: $316
To be paid at the rate of $25 per month, starting 04/01/16 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  5 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
